Archive




Interaction design for understanding, learning, and exploring.

I design things that help people learn and understand more effortlessly. I don't want to demand your attention on social media, so you'll find most of my updates happening on this website.



BACKGROUND


I learned about what the word "experience" actually means while getting my BFA in Interaction Design at California College of the Arts in San Francisco. During my time at CCA, I crafted many experiences for others, ranging from the the elegant and poetic speculative mobility futures with Ford Motors, to the practicality of the future of student loan payments with Visa. In the summer of 2017 I interned as a Experience Designer at the consumer product firm fuseproject, where I worked on smart home fitness interfaces, and VR product demo galleries.

In the summer of 2018 I collaborated on a design sprint with IDEO CoLab as well as interned for the consumer lending company Blend as a product design intern. Here, I redesigned the new hire onboarding experience, BlendU, with the help of the Orgational Effectiveness team. Additionally helped design for alignment within the company through the company objectives. made animated videos and data visualizations to emphasize strong points and areas of improvement within Blend. You can view my resume here.




DESIGN PERSPECTIVE


Each day I walk through spaces where each product, advertisement, website, and environment is demanding my own attention from me.

Through design, I hope to use my skills to emphasize moments of exploration and storytelling to create a sense of "enough" for the audience using it.
